Hey my names Jake and im 17 years old and I was wondering if anyone would be able to guide me in getting my xbox360 to play games of an external hard drive, and tell me the precautions i would have to take in doing so for example not using xbox live anymore. I would really appreciate anyones help because I am really stuck. Thanks

@Browsnie1309

You should visit xbox-scene.com. Every sngle queston shoud be answered :)

@ Browny1309 there are only 2 ways to play games from a hard drive, either have a jtagged / RGH modded console so that you can play games from the xbox360's own hard drive or buy the x360 key and play the game iso's i upload from an external hard drive. Jtag or RGH modded consoles are not xbox live safe so you will not be able to play online, however with the x360 key you can use abgx360 to patch for online play, still not 100% safe but no worse than burning games to disc.

@ CrematoryKid you need a modifed console in order to plat this from disc, your drive needs to be flashed in order to play copied games.

@ CrematoryKid you should have LT3.0 flashed or at least LT2.0 then patch the iso with abgx360, for xgd3 games this also adds topology however if your on LT2.0 then for those you should use the downgrader. This though is xgd2 so you just patch then burn to a good quality dual layer dvd using imgburn. Check out youtube or google for video tutorials for everything you need to know :)

@ elzincho why? All XGD2 games are compatible with LT3.0 as are all XGD3 games so why say if there compatible or not as all will be. I already tell you what firmware is needed at the top of each description, for all new XGD2 games you need LT1.9 or above, for XGD3 you need at least LT2.0 then use the downgrader or LT3.0 n patch topology, LT3.0 will play all games!
